```{r importing data}
library(stats)

ACS_eugene <- read.csv("data/acs_5_yr_age_eugene.csv")
ACS_springfield <- read.csv("data/acs_age_sprinfield.csv")
CAHOOTS_eugene <- read.csv("data/cahoots_age_eugene.csv")
CAHOOTS_springfield <- read.csv("data/cahoots_age_springfield.csv")

# names(df) <- c("NewColumnName1", "NewColumnName2", ...)
names(CAHOOTS_eugene) <- c("Age.Groups", "Age.Group.Totals")

names(CAHOOTS_springfield) <- c("Age.Groups", "Age.Group.Totals")
```

```{r}


# Observed counts from CAHOOTS data
observed_counts_eug <- c(2, 62, 444, 1110, 1883, 2322, 2626, 2833, 2550, 2486, 1909, 2455, 2083, 1545, 1131, 480, 188, 159)

# Calculate the total counts in CAHOOTS data
total_counts_cahoots_eug <- sum(observed_counts_eug)

# ACS data proportions, calculated by dividing each group's count by the total of all groups
acs_proportions_eug <- c(6878, 7685, 7316, 14930, 24115, 16338, 11558, 9825, 10579, 8296, 9854, 7098, 9356, 10318, 9423, 6729, 4343, 3289) / sum(c(6878, 7685, 7316, 14930, 24115, 16338, 11558, 9825, 10579, 8296, 9854, 7098, 9356, 10318, 9423, 6729, 4343, 3289))

# Adjust ACS proportions to match the total counts in CAHOOTS data
expected_counts_eug_acs <- acs_proportions_eug * total_counts_cahoots_eug

# Running the Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test
chi_square_result_eug <- chisq.test(x = observed_counts_eug, p = expected_counts_eug_acs / sum(expected_counts_eug_acs))

# Printing the result
print(chi_square_result_eug)


```
